channel.title: GCSE English RevisionPod
channel.itunes:author: Mr Forster, Mr Gallie
channel.description: RevisionPod - English revision made easy.Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpodEvery week, Mr Forster and Mr Gallie bring you a dose of high energy revision to help you achieve the best possible marks in your English GCSE's. Each episode will look at a different question from your set texts and explore how we would analyse the language and contextual factors and how you can then use this knowledge to boost your essay writing. Click on the bio of each episode to download your GCSE RevisionPod handout, complete with the question we are discussing, the quotations and vocabulary we use in the pod and some extra contextual information.
channel.itunes:keywords: GCSE, English, Literature, Language, Shakespeare, Priestley, Poetry, AQA, Edexcel, OCR

item.itunes:title: AQA Language Paper 1, Question 2 - Language Analysis
item.title: AQA Language Paper 1, Question 2 - Language Analysis
item.description:
It’s time to make the leap—the leap across borders and boundaries into a new world both beautiful and terrifying in equal measure. That’s right, we speak, of course, about the leap from literature to language.

This week we tackle AQA language paper one, question two. Make sure you download the resources below as you listen along; they should really help you!

Here is the handout for this episode: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1fZ-iYUI_CzkxrA8O6anaSUJLZ2atrfU8

Here is a pack going through the whole of Language Paper 1: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1rJ5zh4MVU2FT3QZyWDwpQ8koW7nVU-Sb

Email us: englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpod

Happy revising!
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:author: Mr Forster, Mr Gallie

item.itunes:title: AQA Language Paper 1 - Question 3 - Structural Analysis
item.title: AQA Language Paper 1 - Question 3 - Structural Analysis
item.description:
It’s time to step back, waaaaay back. So far back that you can observe the overall shape and structure of the extract. Put down your language analysis microscope, step back and enjoy the view. Forget about the effect of individual words and phrases and think about where the writer is pointing that focus and where and why that changes. Sounds like fun... right?

Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpod

Email us: englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

Download the handout below: https://tinyurl.com/yxnxk4bn

And a revision guide for Language Paper 1: https://tinyurl.com/y4uganwu

item.itunes:title: AQA Language Paper 1 - Question 4 - Evaluation
item.title: AQA Language Paper 1 - Question 4 - Evaluation
item.description:
All aboard the language train. In this episode we tackle question four. Lots of marks available and we tell you how to get them!

Download the essential hand out here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1_0orantjC4iKTi5CFkEQ6HWy2axgS4k3

And the Paper 1 revision pack here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1rJ5zh4MVU2FT3QZyWDwpQ8koW7nVU-Sb

Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpod

Email us: englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

Happy revising

item.itunes:title: AQA Language Paper 1 - Question 5 - Creative Writing
item.title: AQA Language Paper 1 - Question 5 - Creative Writing
item.description:
In an ideal world, you would improve your writing by reading many novels over a period of many years. But do listen in to get some advice on what you can do to revise for this question.

The handout is crucial this week: https://tinyurl.com/y46ovdrx

And do also download the general Language Paper 1 revision guide: https://tinyurl.com/y4uganwu

Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpod

Email us: englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

item.itunes:title: AQA Language Paper 2 - Question 5 - Writing to Argue and Persuade
item.title: AQA Language Paper 2 - Question 5 - Writing to Argue and Persuade
item.description:
In the absence of his dear friend Mr Forster, Mr Gallie takes you through everything you need for Language Paper 2, Question 5. Download the all-important pack right here:
 https://tinyurl.com/y449jfl9

Click here for examples of opinion based writing:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk/commentisfree

And click here for some great speeches:
https://americanrhetoric.com/

Follow us @GRevisionpod 

Email us englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

item.itunes:title: Unseen Poetry episode 1 - 'Valentine' and 'A Red, Red Rose'
item.title: Unseen Poetry episode 1 - 'Valentine' and 'A Red, Red Rose'
item.description:
It's big, it's bold, it's fresh... it's unseen.

New format this week to help you with the skills you need to face the unseen poetry section of your literature exams.

Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpod

email us: englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

And download the two... that's right! TWO handouts here:

How to analyse unseen poetry: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1EmvEG6IwYzv8tLWxdy1YDBes14xIROc-

Today's handout on two unseen poems about love: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1mauMZUXuSentMnjQm_UT-8DuqBd8H7dH

item.itunes:title: Unseen Poetry episode 2 - ‘Stop all the Clocks’ and ‘Remember’
item.title: Unseen Poetry episode 2 - ‘Stop all the Clocks’ and ‘Remember’
item.description:
Unseen poetry round two! Make sure you pause the podcast and have a go at analysing the poem before you listen to us to make sure you get the full unseen experience.

Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpod

Email us: englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

Download the two hand outs below:
Here is the handout on how to analyse any unseen poem: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1EmvEG6IwYzv8tLWxdy1YDBes14xIROc-

Here is the handout looking at the unseen question we study today: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ymcuuIfduo-urgAwMCl2YKCst-WOlu0u

item.itunes:title: Unseen Poetry episode 3 - ‘Harm’ and ‘The Hunchback in the Park’
item.title: Unseen Poetry episode 3 - ‘Harm’ and ‘The Hunchback in the Park’
item.description:
For the third time, we plunge into murky waters aboard the good ship Unseen Poetry. This week's poem features some quite explicit material, although it is nowhere near as disgusting as Mr Forster’s onomatopoeia and for this we can only apologise.

Follow us on Twitter @GRevisionpod

Email us: englishrevisionpod@gmail.com

And download not one, but two(!) hand outs below:

Here is the handout for analysing any unseen poem: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1EmvEG6IwYzv8tLWxdy1YDBes14xIROc-

And here is the handout for the two poems we are looking at today: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1hUo1tjXDHilimAXHREOPaTMpyYduZ0-b
